doc.previous: Dialects from the Southern part of the Greek speaking regions Dodecanese Cyprus etc preserve the pronunciation of the double similar consonants while others pronounce in many words as or preserve ancient double forms etc Linguistic phenomena like the above imply that those characteristics survived within Koine which in turn had countless variations in the Greek speaking world 8
doc.after: Biblical Koine refers to the varieties of Koine Greek used in the Greek Bible and related texts Its main sources are
